page.title: 18HOLTON AREA CONSERVATION
page.content: Wildlife cover is carefully preserved It is comprised of woodland, spinneys low hedges and purpose planted feeding strips providing a habitat for many forms of wildlife. The periphery of Wickenby Airfield resembles heath land Fields are large , mostly hedged. BIRDS seen include pheasants, English & French partridge & woodcock, also kestrels. Pigeons inhabit Wickenby Wood & rooks Holton Plantation, also Barn & Little Owls. Skylarks, snipe & small birds are everywhere. ANIMALS- include foxes & hares using banks & hedges. Rabbits have shallow burrows and suffer myxamatosis. Grey squirrels have recently returned & mice,shrews,moles,stoats,weasles and hedgehogs abound. WATER LIFE-Small fish,newts,a few frogs & toads.Mallard & moorhens nest near pits,ponds, beck & wet areas
